title: warwickplots
text: package offers six colour palettes: one discrete, two divergent three sequential:  warwick_palettes essentially list, individual palettes can accessed name:1 palette essentially vector, can subsetted usual way create new palettes: palettes package provides palettes::pal_ramp() function interpolating colours. example, consider warwick_palettes$aubergine palette:  generate new palette eight colour values darkest mid-point full palette, reverse , can following:  USE GGPLOT2
code: library(warwickplots) plot(warwick_palettes) warwick_palettes$primary #> <palettes_colour[6]> #> • #3C1053 #> • #6DCDB8 #> • #CB333B #> • #F1BE48 #> • #E87722 #> • #00A9CE warwick_palettes$primary[c(1, 3, 5)] #> <palettes_colour[3]> #> • #3C1053 #> • #CB333B #> • #E87722 plot(warwick_palettes$aubergine) ends <- warwick_palettes$aubergine[c(1, 4)] # get new end-points pal_ramp(ends, n = 8, direction = -1) |> plot()

title: warwickplots
text: University Warwick’s typography brand guidance use font Lato online text font Avenir Next print material. theme_warwick() use argument, can one "online" "print" (defaults "online"), ensure appropriate font use, system set , .e. fonts installed packages render plot.

title: warwickplots
text: need ragg, systemfonts, textshaping packages installed. Installing ragg install two: need ensure whenever output plot, using AGG graphics device. RStudio >= 1.4, go Tools -> Global Options -> General -> Graphics set Backend AGG. Quarto, set following YAML:2 RMarkdown, use knitr::opts_chunk$set(dev = "ragg_png") top script.

title: warwickplots
text: use either fonts, first need check installed system: paths tibble show Lato Avenir Next, installed system. show another font, .e. system default, . example, environment vignette rendered, access Lato, Avenir Next. tried set font family plot Avenir Next, display default DejaVuSans instead. Lato installed, can install , either directly Google Fonts using sysfonts package: excellent, detailed guidance setting working custom fonts R, see getting fonts work R post Cara Thompson setting debugging custom fonts post June Choe.
code: systemfonts::match_fonts(c("Lato", "Avenir Next")) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   path                                            index features   #>   <chr>                                           <int> <list>     #> 1 /usr/share/fonts/truetype/lato/Lato-Regular.ttf     0 <font_ftr> #> 2 /usr/share/fonts/truetype/dejavu/DejaVuSans.ttf     0 <font_ftr> sysfonts::font_add_google("Lato")

what: Palettes and Themes Consistent with The University of Warwick's Brand
title: Palettes and Themes Consistent with The University of Warwick's Brand
text: R package colour palettes ggplot2 theme consistent University Warwick’s branding, especially colours typography. palettes built using palettes package. ggplot2 theme heavily inspired work Cara Thompson, particularly talk applying unifying aesthetic plots.

title: Palettes and Themes Consistent with The University of Warwick's Brand
text: can install development version warwickplots GitHub :

title: Palettes and Themes Consistent with The University of Warwick's Brand
text: package offers six colour palettes: one discrete, two divergent three sequential:  details using palettes, please see warwickplots vignette documentation palettes package.
code: library(warwickplots) #> Loading required package: palettes plot(warwick_palettes)

title: Palettes and Themes Consistent with The University of Warwick's Brand
text: plot uses warwick_palettes::primary palette theme_warwick().  theme_warwick() extension ggplot2::theme_minimal(), offering following addition: Text hierarchy, different sizes colours Spacing, giving text room breathe Uses ggtext::element_textbox_simple() plot title subtitle, enable use markdown CSS styling, text-wrapping title/subtitle long Uses Lato Avenir Next font (online print use respectively), system set Note theme_warwick() defaults can overridden subsequent call theme(). details, including ensure system set use custom fonts, see warwickplots vignette.
code: library(ggplot2) library(palmerpenguins) ggplot(penguins, aes(flipper_length_mm, body_mass_g, group = species)) + geom_point(aes(colour = species, shape = species), alpha = 0.8, size = 2) + scale_color_palette_d(warwick_palettes$primary) + labs(title = "Penguin Size, Palmer Station LTER", subtitle = "Flipper length and body mass for **Adelie**, **Chinstrap** and **Gentoo** Penguins. This is based on data made available in the **palmerpenguins** R package.", caption = "Visualization: Ella Kaye, Data: Gorman, Williams & Fraser (2014) DOI: 10.1371/journal.pone.009008", x = "flipper length (mm)", y = "body mass (g)") + theme_warwick() + theme(legend.position = 'none')

what: ggplot2 theme consistent with Warwick Brand — theme_warwick
title: ggplot2 theme consistent with Warwick Brand — theme_warwick
text: ggplot2 theme consistent Warwick Brand

title: ggplot2 theme consistent with Warwick Brand — theme_warwick
ggplot2 theme consistent with Warwick Brand — theme_warwick
text: base_size numeric, base size font use character, one "online" "print" (defaults "online"), determines font used

title: ggplot2 theme consistent with Warwick Brand — theme_warwick
code: if (FALSE) { ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::mpg, ggplot2::aes(cty, hwy)) +    ggplot2::geom_point() +    theme_warwick() }

what: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: Palettes consistent University Warwick's brand.

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: object class palettes_palette 6 colour palettes. Use names(warwick_palettes) return palette names.

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: object class palettes_palette 1 discrete colour palettes. Use names(warwick_palettes_discrete) return palette names.

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: object class palettes_palette 3 sequential colour palettes. Use names(warwick_palettes_sequential) return palette names.

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: object class palettes_palette 2 sequential colour palettes. Use names(warwick_palettes_divergent) return palette names.

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: https://github.com/Warwick-Stats-Resources/warwickplots

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: Ella Kaye

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
code: # Get all palettes by name. names(warwick_palettes) #> [1] "primary"        "aubergine"      "teal"           "ruby"           #> [5] "aubergine_ruby" "aubergine_teal"  # Plot a specific palette plot(warwick_palettes$primary)   #' # Plot all palettes. if (FALSE) { plot(warwick_palettes) }

what: warwickplots: Palettes and Themes Consistent with The University of Warwick's Brand — warwickplots-package
title: warwickplots: Palettes and Themes Consistent with The University of Warwick's Brand — warwickplots-package
text: Colour palettes 'ggplot2' theme consistent University Warwick' branding. Built using 'palettes' package, provides methods printing, formatting, casting coercion, extraction updating components, plotting, colour mixing arithmetic, colour interpolation.

title: warwickplots: Palettes and Themes Consistent with The University of Warwick's Brand — warwickplots-package
text: Maintainer: Ella Kaye ella.m.kaye@warwick.ac.uk (ORCID)
